Description: Floor sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery shallow bowl or plate; glazed black on inside (streaky brownish) with stamped decoration of frieze of tongues with loose palmettes outside. Underside has slight moulding setting off reserved central area, with central dot and circle, from glazed wall; inscription cut on underside in reserved zone.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 480)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1907)
